metadata.title: CVE-2020-36777 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: media:dvbdev: Fix memory leak in dvb_media_device_free() dvb_media_device_free()is leaking memory. Free `dvbdev->adapter->conn` before setting it to NULL,as documented in include/media/media-device.h: "The media_entity instanceitself must be freed explicitly by the driver if required."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36777` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
